entry.title: Relativity 110d: Cosmology - FLRW Geodesics, Cosmological Redshift, Horizons, Comoving Coordinates

media:group.media:title: Relativity 110d: Cosmology - FLRW Geodesics, Cosmological Redshift, Horizons, Comoving Coordinates
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Links/Sources: FLRW redshift derivation: https://www.int.washington.edu/users/dbkaplan/555/lecture_03 de Sitter-Schwarzschild metric links: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_Sitter%E2%80%93Schwarzschild_metric https://physics.stackexchange.com/questions/512385/finding-de-sitter-schwarzschild-metric Phantom Energy/Big Rip: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phantom_energy How non-zero cosmological constant affects orbits: https://physics.stackexchange.com/questions/299152/orbits-in-an-universal-expansion/299162#299162 Expanding Hubble Horizon: https://www.quora.com/Why-isnt-the-event-horizon-of-the-universe-the-same-as-the-Hubble-Sphere-After-all-after-the-expansion-of-space-crosses-the-speed-of-light-wouldnt-that-be-the-horizon-and-the-Hubble-sphere Computing Cosmological Horizons: https://physics.stackexchange.com/questions/212023/if-the-expansion-of-the-universe-accelerates-why-its-horizon-does-not-shrink/213675#213675
0:00 Intro + FLRW Geodesics 7:04 Light-like FLRW Geodesics 11:14 Cosmological Redshift 16:41 Cosmic Rest Frame 18:12 Do we expand along with the universe? 24:51 Cosmological Horizons 32:12 Summary

entry.title: Relativity 110f: Cosmology - Friedmann Equations Derivation + Universe Evolution Models (FINALE)

media:group.media:title: Relativity 110f: Cosmology - Friedmann Equations Derivation + Universe Evolution Models (FINALE)
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Links/Sources: Sean Carroll's 15-page PDF on cosmology: https://preposterousuniverse.com/wp-content/uploads/grnotes-eight.pdf PDF with derivation of "3rd" Friedmann Equation based on Adiabatic expansion (page 19): https://www.uio.no/studier/emner/matnat/astro/nedlagte-emner/AST4220/h09/course-material/lectures.pdf Article on Conservation of Energy in General Relativity: https://math.ucr.edu/home/baez/physics/Relativity/GR/energy_gr.html de Sitter's 1917 paper: https://academic.oup.com/mnras/article/78/1/3/1239878 Video on mathematics of de Sitter space: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dZ-4REivxRU Equation for de Sitter space: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_Sitter_space#Definition Equation for embedding Anti-de Sitter space: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-de_Sitter_space#Definition_and_properties PDF building up dS and AdS space from the basics: http://3dhouse.se/ingemar/relteori/Kurs.pdf Physics Stack exchange post about values of cosmological parameters: https://physics.stackexchange.com/questions/314660/to-what-accuracy-do-we-know-the-value-of-the-cosmological-constant Chronology of the Universe: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chronology_of_the_universe Dark Energy Survey (estimated cosmological parameters): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Energy_Survey Video intro to Dark Energy Survey: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4TkyxLENS5Q Dr Becky talks about Dark Energy Survey: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IHMFDxLcMYs Cosmic Inflation: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inflation_(cosmology) "Gravity in a Nutshell" by A. Zee also has chapters on de Sitter and anti-de Sitter spacetimes (IX.10 and IX.11)
Sources for the estimations of cosmological parameters: WMAP: https://arxiv.org/pdf/0803.0732.pdf BOOMERanG: https://arxiv.org/pdf/astro-ph/0004404.pdf Planck: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lambda-CDM_model#Parameters
Other topics I didn't cover: Killing Vectors: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_vector_field Kerr Metric (rotating black holes): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerr_metric Einstein-Hilbert Action (Lagrangian formulation of GR): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Einstein%E2%80%93Hilbert_action
0:00 Introduction 1:04 Review of FLRW metric and Perfect Fluid 3:09 Friedmann Equations Derivation 7:04 "3rd" Friedmann Equation (conservation of energy) 8:25 Universes dominated by matter, radiation, dark energy 14:25 Einstein Static Universe 17:51 de Sitter / anti-de Sitter Universes 25:16 Cosmological parameters 28:02 Cosmological Models with Λ = 0 33:08 Cosmological Models with Λ ≠ 0 36:43 The model for our universe 39:17 Conclusion

entry.title: Relativity 110b: Cosmology - FLRW Metric Derivation (3 possible geometries)

media:group.media:title: Relativity 110b: Cosmology - FLRW Metric Derivation (3 possible geometries)
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Ricci Curvature of 3-sphere: https://www.physics.mcgill.ca/~rhb/ph514/10sol6.pdf Ricci Curvature of Hyperbolic plane: https://thatsmaths.files.wordpress.com/2013/10/134-half-plane-curvature.pdf Info on Hyperboloid Model: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperboloid_model Hyperbolic Geometry video by Henry Segerman: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eGEQ_UuQtYs Alex Flournoy video on FLRW metric: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9WToQrPPeXs Dietterich Labs video on FLRW metric: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cbRy3sXDJ-U
0:00 Introduction 1:10 Cosmological Principle 4:03 Flat universe and scale factor a(t) 6:52 Closed/spherical universe 12:22 Open/hyperbolic universe 17:55 Unifying the 3 metrics 22:58 Reduced-Circumference Polar Coordinates

entry.title: Relativity 108d: Schwazrschild Metric - Eddington-Finkelstein, Kruskal-Szekeres, White/Wormholes

media:group.media:title: Relativity 108d: Schwazrschild Metric - Eddington-Finkelstein, Kruskal-Szekeres, White/Wormholes
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Additional Resources: Sean Carroll: https://preposterousuniverse.com/wp-content/uploads/grnotes-seven.pdf Discussion about above notes: https://www.physicsforums.com/threads/outgoing-eddington-finkelstein-coordinates.628702/ Notes using +--- metric: http://www.physik.uni-regensburg.de/forschung/gebhardt/gebhardt_files/skripten/Lect04KruskalCoord.pdf http://www.physik.uni-regensburg.de/forschung/gebhardt/gebhardt_files/skripten/Lect04KruskalCoord.pdf
Penrose Diagrams: Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penrose_diagram PBS spacetime #1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mht-1c4wc0Q PBS spacetime #2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4v9A9hQUcBQ
Read more about Flamm's Parabaloid: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schwarzschild_metric#Flamm's_paraboloid
Other Videos on EF/KS coordinates: Schuller/Winter School: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7VJzouE9rNE&list=PLFeEvEPtX_0S6vxxiiNPrJbLu9aK1UVC_&index=22 GRSS: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SkWLg3pBwGY&list=PL9_n3Tqzq9iWtgD8POJFdnVUCZ_zw6OiB&index=188 Arindam Kumar Chatterjee:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4PI4jI6sxb8 Arindam Kumar Chatterjee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PMXkptjAdOo K Raviteja: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gMnKRVT-QmU
0:00 Intro 2:58 Non-orthogonal + Light-like Vectors Review 7:16 Ingoing Eddington-Finkelstein Coordinates 15:36 Outgoing Eddington-Finkelstein Coordinates 17:19 Kruskal-Szekeres Coordinates 28:03 KS 4 Spacetime Regions 33:01 Wormholes (Einstein-Rosen Bridge) 36:06 Summary

media:group.media:title: Relativity 110c: Cosmology - FLRW Tensor/Coefficient Derivations
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Some other sources for the tensor formulas are: - Sean Carroll GR Cosmology notes: https://preposterousuniverse.com/wp-content/uploads/grnotes-eight.pdf - Section 2.9 of the Catalogue of Spacetimes (note they they take the g_tt metric term to be c^2 instead of 1, so the locations of c in the formulas are different: https://arxiv.org/pdf/0904.4184.pdf
0:00 Intro + Notation 2:48 Connection Coefficients 10:08 Ricci Tensor 19:04 Ricci Scalar

entry.title: Relativity 110a: Cosmology - Introduction to Modern Cosmology

media:group.media:title: Relativity 110a: Cosmology - Introduction to Modern Cosmology
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Einstein's 1917 paper: https://einsteinpapers.press.princeton.edu/vol6-trans/433 Friedmann's 1922 paper: https://wwwphy.princeton.edu//~steinh/ph563/friedmann.pdf Einstein's objection + retraction: https://einsteinpapers.press.princeton.edu/vol13-trans/301 https://einsteinpapers.press.princeton.edu/vol14-trans/77 Lemaître's 1927 paper: https://academic.oup.com/mnras/article/91/5/483/985165?login=false Hubble's 1929 paper: https://www.pnas.org/doi/full/10.1073/pnas.15.3.168 Ralph Alpher's 1948 CMB prediction paper: https://sci-hub.hkvisa.net/10.1103/PhysRev.74.1577
0:00 Introduction 1:35 Einstein's 1917 cosmology paper 9:46 Friedmann Equations 14:38 Galactic Redshift 18:54 Lemaitre & Hubble propose an expanding universe 22:44 Cosmic Microwave Background 28:10 Dark Energy and Universe's Accelerating Expansion 31:41 Summary

entry.title: Relativity 109e: Gravitational Waves - How Gravitational Wave Affect Free Particles

media:group.media:title: Relativity 109e: Gravitational Waves - How Gravitational Wave Affect Free Particles
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Some PDFs on calculating the components of the Riemann Curvature Tensor for gravitational waves: See Section 5.2 of: https://pages.pomona.edu/~tmoore/LesHouches/les-houches-5.pdf See Section 8.2 of: http://star-www.st-and.ac.uk/~hz4/gr/hendry_GRwaves.pdf
Some helpful PDFs on the Lorenz Gauge: https://pages.pomona.edu/~tmoore/LesHouches/les-houches-4.pdf https://pages.pomona.edu/~tmoore/LesHouches/les-houches-5.pdf
Other Sources on Gravitational Waves: Sean Carroll: https://preposterousuniverse.com/wp-content/uploads/grnotes-six.pdf Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linearized_gravity YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kIBdtbCszB0 PDF 1: http://star-www.st-and.ac.uk/~hz4/gr/hendry_GRwaves.pdf PDF 2: https://www.tat.physik.uni-tuebingen.de/~kokkotas/Teaching/NS.BH.GW_files/GW_Physics.pdf
0:00 Review 1:35 Gravitational Waves vs Wavy Coordinates 3:56 Geodesics for Gravitational Waves 7:19Proper Distance between Geodesics 11:50 Interpreting + and x Polarizations 15:49 Visualizing Gravitational Waves 17:23 Summary

entry.title: Relativity 109d: Gravitational Waves - Transverse-Traceless Gauge (Plus and Cross Polarizations)

entry.title: Relativity 109c: Gravitational Waves - Wave Derivation (The Lorenz Gauge)

media:group.media:title: Relativity 109c: Gravitational Waves - Wave Derivation (The Lorenz Gauge)
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Some helpful PDFs on the Lorenz Gauge: https://pages.pomona.edu/~tmoore/LesHouches/les-houches-4.pdf https://pages.pomona.edu/~tmoore/LesHouches/les-houches-5.pdf
Other Sources on Gravitational Waves: Sean Carroll: https://preposterousuniverse.com/wp-content/uploads/grnotes-six.pdf Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linearized_gravity YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kIBdtbCszB0 PDF 1: http://star-www.st-and.ac.uk/~hz4/gr/hendry_GRwaves.pdf PDF 2: https://www.tat.physik.uni-tuebingen.de/~kokkotas/Teaching/NS.BH.GW_files/GW_Physics.pdf
0:00 Introduction to Lorenz Gauge 2:10 Proving 3 terms in G go to zero 5:09 Displacement Field 8:03 Metric Tensor transformation 10:30 Riemann Tensor transformation 12:05 h-bar transformation 14:43 Lorenz gauge gives the Wave Equation 17:57 Gauge Transformations in Electricity and Magnetism 22:12 Gauge Transformations in Linearized Gravity

entry.title: Relativity 109b: Gravitational Wave - Linearized Gravity / Weak Gravity

media:group.media:title: Relativity 109b: Gravitational Wave - Linearized Gravity / Weak Gravity
media:group.media:description:
Full relativity playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJHszsWbB6hqlw73QjgZcFh4DrkQLSCQa Powerpoint slide files: https://github.com/eigenchris/MathNotes/tree/master/Relativity Leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/eigenchris
Binary System orbit described in section 9.2 of this PDF: http://star-www.st-and.ac.uk/~hz4/gr/hendry_GRwaves.pdf Einstein's 1916 paper on Gravitational waves: https://einsteinpapers.press.princeton.edu/vol6-trans/213 Official LIGO site: https://www.ligo.caltech.edu/ LIGO FAQ: https://www.ligo.caltech.edu/page/faq
Other Sources: Sean Carroll: https://preposterousuniverse.com/wp-content/uploads/grnotes-six.pdf Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linearized_gravity YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kIBdtbCszB0 PDF 1: http://star-www.st-and.ac.uk/~hz4/gr/hendry_GRwaves.pdf PDF 2: https://www.tat.physik.uni-tuebingen.de/~kokkotas/Teaching/NS.BH.GW_files/GW_Physics.pdf
Physics Stack Exchange question about the derivatives of h (comment response by Valter Moretti, who is a university professor): https://physics.stackexchange.com/questions/593298/linearized-gravity-derivatives-of-the-metric-perturbation
0:00 Introduction to Linearized Gravity 2:26 Inverse Metric 5:03 Connection Coefficients 6:15 Riemann Tensor 7:39 Ricci Tensor 8:53 Ricci Scalar 9:58 Einstein Tensor 13:02 Summary

entry.title: Relativity 109a - Gravitational Waves: Introduction (LIGO, Wave Equation)

media:group.media:title: Relativity 109a - Gravitational Waves: Introduction (LIGO, Wave Equation)

Binary System orbit described in section 9.2 of this PDF: http://star-www.st-and.ac.uk/~hz4/gr/hendry_GRwaves.pdf Einstein's 1916 paper on Gravitational waves: https://einsteinpapers.press.princeton.edu/vol6-trans/213 Official LIGO site: https://www.ligo.caltech.edu/ LIGO FAQ: https://www.ligo.caltech.edu/page/faq
Other Sources: Sean Caroll: https://preposterousuniverse.com/wp-content/uploads/grnotes-six.pdf Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linearized_gravity Physics Unsimplified Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kIBdtbCszB0 Other helpful PDF: https://www.tat.physik.uni-tuebingen.de/~kokkotas/Teaching/NS.BH.GW_files/GW_Physics.pdf

media:group.media:title: eigenchris's Math/Physics YouTube Channel Recommendations
media:group.media:description:
[A1] Robert Davie https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCm7lQ5bSq6yBHVPYJ7J561w [A2] Dietterich Labs https://www.youtube.com/c/DietterichLabs/videos [A3] dXoverdteqprogress https://www.youtube.com/user/dXoverdteqprogress/videos [A4] XylyXylyX https://www.youtube.com/user/XylyXylyX/videos [A5] Noah Explains Physics https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZSC7wgBq3RSLKoJDfGL0Rg/videos [A6] Physics with Elliot: https://www.youtube.com/c/PhysicswithElliot/videos [A7] Sander Konijnenberg https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCb4KzvTvz-9kMuL3-9Nj_fA/videos
[B1] Alex Flournoy https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHAwDVSS8oDLLln07cNdU6A/videos [B2] Frederic P Schuller https://www.youtube.com/c/FredericSchuller/videos [B2 also] Schuller's General Relativity playlist on a separate channel: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFeEvEPtX_0S6vxxiiNPrJbLu9aK1UVC_ [B3] Hitoshi Murayama https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoIq8T6hxfk6ZtLBv9CMCnQ/videos [B4] Peter Woit https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdSEKN94Jo1xjUHVyfEfIjg Peter Woit's work-in-progress text: https://www.math.columbia.edu/~woit/QMbook/qmbook-latest.pdf [B5] Leonard Susskind (individual courses are 10 videos each) https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLjeznqO-C0AVy5P39Hbybl0ew_03IkIx [B6] Tadashi Tokieda https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SXHHvoaSctc&list=PLTBqohhFNBE_09L0i-lf3fYXF5woAbrzJ [B7] Introduction to differential forms playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLB8F2D70E034E9C29
[C1] Snoopy Topology Notes https://www.math.colostate.edu/~renzo/teaching/Topology10/Notes.pdf [C2] Quick and Dirty Introduction to Exterior Algebra https://web.archive.org/web/20191221153300/http://brickisland.net/cs177/?p=174 https://web.archive.org/web/20191221153400/http://brickisland.net/cs177/?p=184 https://web.archive.org/web/20191221195625/http://brickisland.net/cs177/?p=200 https://web.archive.org/web/20191222002003/http://brickisland.net/cs177/?p=248 https://web.archive.org/web/20191221104907/http://brickisland.net/cs177/?p=264 [C2 also] The author of the above has a YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL9_jI1bdZmz0hIrNCMQW1YmZysAiIYSSS [C3] Sean Carroll GR Lecture Notes https://www.preposterousuniverse.com/grnotes/ [C4] Exploring Black Holes: https://www.eftaylor.com/exploringblackholes/ [C5] Catalogue of Spacetimes https://arxiv.org/pdf/0904.4184.pdf [C6] Einstein's Papers Online https://einsteinpapers.press.princeton.edu/
